author: Laura Ferguson
title: Sleet and snow weather warning for Greater Glasgow as more flooding expected this weekend - Glasgow Live
text: A [weather](https://www.glasgowlive.co.uk/all-about/weather) warning for snow and rain is in place across parts of the Greater Glasgow area for tomorrow. The yellow alert issued by the Met Office comes into effect at 8am on Saturday, December 30 and will remain in place throughout the entirety of the day, coming to an end at 11.59pm that night. The warning is in place for the majority of Scotland, including Renfrewshire and Dunbartonshire. Forecasters have warned that "a period of sleet and snow, turning to rain, will bring some disruption during Saturday." People in affected areas have been warned to prepare for some [travel disruption](https://www.glasgowlive.co.uk/all-about/traffic-and-travel). READ MORE: [Last days of 2023 ‘unsettled’ weather says Met Office with ‘colder-than-average’ January on the way](https://www.glasgowlive.co.uk/news/last-days-2023-unsettled-weather-28361284) READ MORE: [Huge Glasgow Central Station queues as passengers travelling to London stuck due to cancellations](https://www.glasgowlive.co.uk/news/glasgow-news/huge-glasgow-central-station-queues-28360206) It comes after Storm Gerrit battered the country, leading to [widespread chaos across roads and railways](https://www.glasgowlive.co.uk/news/storm-gerrit-glasgow-drivers-warned-28355259) on Wednesday, December 27, with the aftermath of the storm continuing well into Thursday. The Met Office warning reads: "An active frontal system will extend northeastwards through Saturday bringing heavy rain to low levels and a period of snow across higher ground to some parts of Scotland. Snow accumulations are expected largely above 250-300 metres, where 5 to 10 cm may accumulate. "At lower levels mostly rain is expected with 15-25 mm, although some snow accumulations may occur for a time over northwestern areas, with perhaps 1 to 3 cm in places. Snow turning to rain in the south early afternoon and melting snow over high ground along with some heavy rain and saturated ground may lead to some flooding of roads and railways. Rain and snow clearing from the south through the afternoon and evening."
